interestingFact: India is the world's largest democracy and the second-most populous country.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The U.S. has the world's largest economy, with a GDP exceeding $25 trillion.
China is the most populous country in the world and has the world's fastest-growing economy.
Japan has the world's third-largest economy and is famous for its technological innovations.
Germany is the largest economy in Europe and a leader in engineering and automobile manufacturing.
The UK is home to the world's oldest parliament, established in 1295.
France is the most visited country in the world, attracting over 80 million tourists annually.
Brazil is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system.
Canada has the world's longest coastline, stretching over 202,080 km.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, covering 11 time zones.
Rome is home to Vatican City, the world's smallest independent country.
South Korea is known for its K-pop music industry, with BTS being one of the most famous bands.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria (executive), Cape Town (legislative), and Bloemfontein (judicial).
Argentina is famous for tango dancing and has the widest avenue in the world (Avenida 9 de Julio).
Saudi Arabia is home to Mecca, the holiest city in Islam, where millions of Muslims go for pilgrimage annually.
Istanbul is the only city in the world that spans two continents: Europe and Asia.
Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
